Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Bishop Joseph Northover, Pastor, House of God Miracle Center, 509 E. 78th St., Brooklyn, N.Y. 11236.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Maisel.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Bishop Joseph Northover, Pastor, House of God Miracle Center, 509 East 78th Street, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11236.

Council Member Maisel moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.MinutesNote: None

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Items.MinutesNote: None

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Mr. Michael Rivadeneyra, a resident of the Bronx, candidate for designation by the Council and subsequent appointment by the Mayor to the New York City Civilian Complaint Review Board.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Michael Rivadeneyra, Civilian Complaint Review Board

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Items.MinutesNote: None

Items.Title: Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Greenfield:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the actions of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure application nos. C 170093 MMM and C 170278 PPM shall be subject to Council review.  These items are related to application nos. C 170275 ZMM and  N 170276 ZRM, which are subject to Council review pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Planning, Involving: the elimination, discontinuance and closing of a portion of Second Ave between E.126th St & E.127th St & the delineation of a sidewalk easement, Manhattan (C170093MMM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Chin:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure application no. C 160349 ZSM shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 40 Wooster Street, Manhattan (C160349ZSM)

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a wireless communications surcharge
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Wireless communications surcharge.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the maximum qualifying income for the senior citizen homeowner’s exemption and the disabled homeowner’s exemption
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Approved by Council
Items.MatterName: Increasing the maximum qualifying income for the senior citizen homeowner’s exemption and the disabled homeowner’s exemption.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Laid Over by Council
Items.MatterName: Reporting response times for firefighting units and ambulances to emergencies.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Health
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting smoking and the use of electronic cigarettes in the common areas of all multiple dwellings
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting smoking and the use of electronic cigarettes in the common areas of all multiple dwellings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the sale of tobacco products in pharmacies
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sale of tobacco products in pharmacies.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the retail cigarette dealer license fee
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Increasing the retail cigarette dealer license fee.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the regulation of electronic cigarettes and the licensing of electronic cigarette retail dealers
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Regulation of electronic cigarettes and the licensing of electronic cigarette retail dealers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the regulation of retail dealers of tobacco products and of electronic cigarettes, the establishment of price floors and minimum package sizes for tobacco products and shisha, and the establishment of a tax on tobacco products other than cigarettes
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Regulation of retail dealers of tobacco products and of electronic cigarettes, the establishment of price floors and minimum package sizes for tobacco products and shisha, and the establishment of a tax on tobacco products other than cigarettes.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to expanding the retail dealer license to include retailers of tobacco products and setting caps on retail dealer licenses, and to repeal subdivision c of section 17-702, relating to the definition of cigarette license
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Expanding the retail dealer license to include retailers of tobacco products and setting caps on retail dealer licenses, and to repeal subdivision c of section 17-702, relating to the definition of cigarette license.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to disclosure of smoking policies for class A multiple dwellings
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Disclosure of smoking policies for class A multiple dwellings.

Items.MatterName: Remedies for the breach of the duty of an owner to refrain from harassment of tenants.

Items.Title: General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to generating, capturing and utilizing energy from city’s water supply, wastewater treatment systems and natural bodies of water
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Generating, capturing and utilizing energy from city’s water supply, wastewater treatment systems and natural bodies of water.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to installation of utility-scale battery storage systems on city buildings and conducting a feasibility study on installation of such systems throughout the city
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Installation of utility-scale battery storage systems on city buildings and conducting a feasibility study on installation of such systems throughout the city.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the maximum qualifying income for the senior citizen homeowner’s exemption and the disabled homeowner’s exemption
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Increasing the maximum qualifying income for the senior citizen homeowner’s exemption and the disabled homeowner’s exemption.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A.7063/ S.5563, legislation regarding the creation of a pilot program to improve social and emotional learning in schools, and calling on the City’s Department of Education to establish such a pilot program in every community school district.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Creation of a pilot program to improve social and emotional learning in schools. (A.7063/ S.5563)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a wireless communications surcharge
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Wireless communications surcharge.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to amending the definition of harassment to include discriminatory threats and requests for proof of citizenship status
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Amending the definition of harassment to include discriminatory threats and requests for proof of citizenship status.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to fees charged by bail bondsmen
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Fees charged by bail bondsmen.

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. James)

The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. James).

There were 42 Council Members marked present at this Stated Meeting.

There is presently one vacancy in the Council.
At this point, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. James) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
